page.title: 08PARKWOOD
page.content: Before the Second World War most of Parkwood was woodland and some trees have been left as the area has been developed, notably around a large playing field where local football teams play. The housing consists of terraces and small blocks of flats with some semi-detached houses and bungalows; a number of old people live in these and they attend the old people's Christmas Party that is arranged each year by Senacre School. There is a large block of shops around a car park which includes two newsagents (one the P.O.), a chemist, a supermarket, a fish and chip shop and a sandwich bar, where some schoolchildren get their lunch instead of having school dinners. On the edge of the park is a Kent Boys' Club.
